newsitem.title: INDIA: India plans to import currency notes amid shortage.
newsitem.headline: India plans to import currency notes amid shortage.

text.p: India has decided to import 3.60 billion pieces of currency notes to overcome an acute shortage, the Press Trust of India (PTI) quoted Finance Minister P. Chidambaram as saying on Thursday.

Chidambaram was quoted as telling the upper house of parliament, Rajya Sabha, the Reserve Bank of India had been authorised to import two billion pieces of 100 rupee notes and 1.6 billion of 500 rupee notes in a one-time import.
Current annual domestic production is around 5.5 billion pieces.
Chidambaram said new facilities were being planned to meet India's currency demand, rising by 15 to 20 percent a year and expected to reach 18 billion pieces by 2000.
India will modernise facilities at printing presses in Nasik, in the western state of Maharashtra, and Dewas, in the central state of Madhya Pradesh, and at two others, he said. ($1=35.8 rupees)
